reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 22, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Grieving and Living
reviews.reviewText: I don’t know if everyone has a bucket list, but I do and I truly believe everyone should, even if you aren’t dying. It helps to make sure you do the things you would truly like to do before you one day leave this earth. I love that Bree had made a bucket list at such a young age and she thought her sister would be brave enough to finish it for her when she found out she was dying. This book is a love story of sister love, family love and also the realities of medical debt, even when a person dies. Grieving is a challenge and even more so when Jodie, Bree’s sister has to feel her every step of the way in trying to complete her bucket list.This is a fantastic read. Looking forward to reading more by this author.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Overall, a good story.
reviews.reviewText: 3.75/5 stars.Bree Boyd is popular on instagram - which a million followers. She unfortunately dies from leukemia at the young age of 26 and leaves her family with tons of medical debt. After she dies, her family finds out that Bree wants her sister Jodie to finish off the things she didn't get to finish on her bucket list. In turn, all of her medical bills will be paid in full. The downfall though is that all of it has to be broadcasted on social media. Jodie goes through some humiliating experiences but though it all she rediscovers herself. The question is will she finish #100 on the list - fall in love?Overall, it was a good story. I definitely cried during this book, as it does show Bree's family and best friend trying to move through life while grieving.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Such a beautiful story
reviews.reviewText: It started a bit slow, but once it picked up I was hooked. Such a beautiful story portraying realistic grief, and so many forms of love and how it never dies. I laughed a bit and cried so much 10/10 loved it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 31, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This book surprised me. It took a bit to grab me, but when it did, I couldn't put it down. I would highly recommend it. Not many books make me cry; I usually discontinue reading sad books. This one wasn't sad..... It made tears come because it touched on so many things that life throws at all of us, and yet we still keep going.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 13, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Read this book!
reviews.reviewText: Heartfelt, heart wrenching, and inspirational. Grateful to travel along on Bree's and Movie's journey. A must read for anyone who has ever lost someone close to your heart.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Surprising at Times
reviews.reviewText: I didn’t expect the tears that sprang suddenly in some parts of the book or the little giggles after meeting Tish, but I appreciated it as it kept the story moving and made me fall in love with the characters.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 14, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I loved almost everything about this story. The grief of the family being overshadowed by this craziness of the bucket list. And not only the bucket list of someone else, but doing it in front of the eyes of anyone on social media? It was quite the adventure with plenty of tears and laughs and characters that really came to life. The only thing I didn’t like was Kelly. He was one note and not terribly interesting. He felt shoved into the story. Take him out, let the story be about grief and family and new friends, and it might have been one of my favorite stories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This was a really special book for me. It reminds me of my 2 daughters, the oldest, very outgoing, and the youngest more reserved.I also has a bucket list with my college roommate and this book reminded me I need to work on it.

Definitely in my Top 5 for 2023.This book touched my heart, shattered it and put it back together again and again.It made me laugh, it made me cry, it reached out and reminded me that it is never too late to grab hold of your dreams and run with them. Thoroughly enjoyed!
